communications.phone_system_international: country code - 680; satellite earth station - 1 Intelsat (Pacific Ocean) (2015)
communications.phone_system_domestic: fixed-line and mobile-cellular services available with a combined subscribership of over 140 per 100 persons
communications.broadcast_media: no TV stations; a cable TV network covers the major islands and provides access to rebroadcasts, on a delayed basis, of a number of US stations, as well as access to a number of real-time satellite TV channels; about a half dozen radio stations (1 governm (2009)

economy.overview: The economy consists of tourism and other services such as trade, subsistence agriculture, and fishing. Government is a major employer of the work force relying on financial assistance from the US under the Compact of Free Association (Compact) with the US that took effect after the end of the UN trusteeship on 1 October 1994. The US provided Palau with roughly $700 million in aid for the first 15 years following commencement of the Compact in 1994 in return for unrestricted access to its land and waterways for strategic purposes. The population enjoys a per capita income roughly double that of the Philippines and much of Micronesia. ++  ++ Business and leisure tourist arrivals numbered over 125,000 in fiscal year 2014, a 13.4% increase over the previous year. Long-run prospects for tourism have been bolstered by the expansion of air travel in the Pacific, the rising prosperity of industrial East Asia, and the willingness of foreigners to finance infrastructure development. Proximity to Guam, the region's major destination for tourists from East Asia, and a regionally competitive tourist infrastructure enhance Palau's advantage as a destination.
economy.gdp_power_parity: $276 million (2016 est.) ++ $276 million (2015 est.) ++ $252.3 million (2014 est.)
economy.agriculture_products: coconuts, copra, cassava (manioc, tapioca), sweet potatoes; fish
economy.industries: tourism, craft items (from shell, wood, pearls), construction, garment making
economy.external_debt: $18.38 billion (31 December 2014 est.) ++ $16.47 billion (31 December 2013 est.)
economy.imports_commodities: machinery and equipment, fuels, metals; foodstuffs

geography.location_description: Oceania, group of islands in the North Pacific Ocean, southeast of the Philippines
geography.area_note: slightly more than 2.5 times the size of Washington, DC
geography.climate: tropical; hot and humid; wet season May to November
geography.terrain: varying topography from the high, mountainous main island of Babelthuap to low, coral islands usually fringed by large barrier reefs
geography.notes: westernmost archipelago in the Caroline chain, consists of six island groups totaling more than 300 islands; includes World War II battleground of Beliliou (Peleliu) and world-famous rock islands

government.name: Republic of Palau
government.name_etymology: from the Palauan name for the islands, Belau, which likely derives from the Palauan word "beluu" meaning "village"
government.government_type: presidential republic in free association with the US
government.capital_time_zone: UTC+9 (14 hours ahead of Washington, DC, during Standard Time)
government.administrative_divisions: 16 states; Aimeliik, Airai, Angaur, Hatohobei, Kayangel, Koror, Melekeok, Ngaraard, Ngarchelong, Ngardmau, Ngatpang, Ngchesar, Ngeremlengui, Ngiwal, Peleliu, Sonsorol
government.national_holiday: Constitution Day, 9 July (1981), day of a national referendum to pass the new constitution; Independence Day, 1 October (1994)
government.legal_system: mixed legal system of civil, common, and customary law
government.executive_chief_of_state: President Tommy REMENGESAU (since 17 January 2013); Vice President Antonio BELLS (since 17 January 2013); note - the president is both chief of state and head of government
government.executive_head_of_government: President Tommy REMENGESAU (since 17 January 2013); Vice President Antonio BELLS (since 17 January 2013)
government.executive_cabinet: Cabinet appointed by the president with the advice and consent of the Senate; also includes the vice president; the Council of Chiefs consists of chiefs from each of the states who advise the president on issues concerning traditional laws, customs, and their relationship to the constitution and laws of Palau
government.executive_elections: president and vice president directly elected on separate ballots by absolute majority popular vote in 2 rounds if needed for a 4-year term (eligible for a second term); election last held on 1 November 2016 (next to be held in November 2020)
government.executive_election_results: Tommy REMENGESAU elected president; percent of vote - Tommy REMENGESAU 51.3%, Surangel WHIPPS, Jr. 48.7%; Antonio BELLS elected vice president
government.legislative_description: bicameral National Congress or Olbiil Era Kelulau consists of the Senate (9 seats; members directly elected in single-seat constituencies by majority vote to serve 4-year terms) and the House of Delegates (16 seats; members directly elected in single-seat constituencies by simple majority vote to serve 4-year terms)
government.legislative_elections: Senate - last held on 6 November 2012 (next to be held in November 2016); House of Delegates - last held on 6 November 2012 (next to be held in November 2016)
government.legislative_election_results: Senate - percent of vote - NA; seats - independent 9; House of Delegates - percent of vote - NA; seats - independent 16
government.legislative_highest_courts: Supreme Court (consists of the chief justice and 3 associate justices organized into appellate trial divisions; also within the Supreme Court organization are the Common Pleas and Land Courts)
government.legislative_judge_selection: justices nominated by a 7-member independent body consisting of judges, presidential appointees, and lawyers, and appointed by the president; judges appointed until mandatory retirement at age 65
government.international_organization_participation: ACP, ADB, AOSIS, FAO, IAEA, IBRD, ICAO, ICRM, IDA, IFC, IFRCS, ILO, IMF, IMO, IMSO, IOC, IPU, MIGA, OPCW, PIF, Sparteca, SPC, UN, UNAMID, UNCTAD, UNESCO, WHO
government.flag_description: light blue with a large yellow disk shifted slightly to the hoist side; the blue color represents the ocean, the disk represents the moon; Palauans consider the full moon to be the optimum time for human activity; it is also considered a symbol of peace, love, and tranquility
government.national_symbols: bai (native meeting house); national colors: blue, yellow

issues.international_disputes: maritime delineation negotiations continue with Philippines, Indonesia
issues.refugees: maritime delineation negotiations continue with Philippines, Indonesia

people.literacy_definition: age 15 and over can read and write

ethnicities.name: Palauan (Micronesian with Malayan and Melanesian admixtures)
